page.title: 03Education in Rogate
page.content: The village school is over a hundred years old though it has been moderised in 1962. Now there are three classrooms and a large hall. A headmistress and two teachers look after the fifty seven children whose ages start at five and rise to ten. The oldest children's room has a carpet with cushions on it where poetry and library books can be read. A computer often stands here. Outside there is plenty of space to play on, a large field with several trees makes lots of room for football and catch games. During the summer term we go swimming in the learner pool.Nearly everyone can swim by the time they leave the school. Another popular activity is anything to do with natural history especially collecting specimens and examing them in the classroom.
